title: On The Eve Of Annual March For Life, ‘The View’ Co-Hosts Argue Everyone Is ‘Pro-Life’
text:
— Diana Larson (@Iam_mykidsmom) January 26, 2017 
The pair did receive some support from several like-minded Twitter users. . @WhoopiGoldberg @TheView BRAVO! We are ALL pro life, who ISNT 4 life?! We r #prochoice for ALL women. Let's #reproductiverights @PPact 
— Jill Frank (@jillf50) January 26, 2017 
Hostin went on to point out a majority of Catholics “believe abortion should be legal” despite the faith’s strong showing at the annual March for Life. 
The problem, she said, lies in pro-abortion rights advocates focusing too much attention on a few extremists among a large group of Americans fighting for the rights of the unborn. 
“My point has been all along is that you can’t define the pro-life movement by the fringe you see,” Hostin said. “Many, many people in the pro-life movement, 54 percent of Catholics, are like me, Whoopi, that believe abortion is wrong.” 
Goldberg responded by noting she is concerned about her own view on the subject being maligned by those who disagree with her. 
“I don’t like having people define the fact that I think having a choice is a good thing,” she said. 
Despite expressing her belief that abortion “is something that some women have to do,” Goldberg claimed “it doesn’t make [her] any less of a pro-life person.” What do you think? Scroll down to comment below. Advertisement Popular Right Now
